trans-unit.source: Represents the base class from which custom expression writers must derive to write custom expressions.
When overridden in a derived class, reports on how the object uses fields and properties in the context type.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAnalysis"></xref> method to store fields and properties read by a condition or read by an action.
`true` if the expression is being read from; `false` if the expression is not being read from.
`true` if the expression is being written to; `false` if the expression is not being written to.
The path of a field or property.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a deep copy of the current <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref>.
A deep copy of the current <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, decompiles the custom expression into string form.
A mutable string for the decompiled expression.
This method should append the decompiled syntax for this subexpression.
The parent code expression.
This can be used to determine operator precedence, and whether this subexpression needs to be parenthesized.
When overridden in a derived class, evaluates the custom expression.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleExecution"></xref> to execute the expression.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleExpressionResult"></xref> that indicates the result of the rule execution.
Compares the current expression to another expression to determine whether they are equal.
The expression to compare the current expression to.
`true` to show that the expressions are equal; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, verifies that the expression is configured correctly and has no errors.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleValidation"></xref> to manage the validation process.
`true` if the expression is being written to; `false` if the expression is not being written to.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleExpressionInfo"></xref> for the expression.
